review_body: The hotel is located very near to Daimon Station and Hamamatsucho station. Easy access to Haneda Airport through Monorail next to Hamamatsucho Station. There is beauty & health shop nearby. Family mart, laws on and restaurants with reasonable price are within 5 to 10mins walking distance. There is LG clothing disinfectant system in the room, laundry room is available too. Checked in & out by Robot, but no worries. If the robot can't handle well, can always press button to call the staff for help. Our luggages were already place in the room after we checked in at night as we arrived in the morning and kept our luggage in the hotel. Good service.

We stayed at Phiten Space Design rooms. Twin room is very comfy for our family. We have a really good night sleep there. Location is very convenient, super close to subway, JR, and monorail to Haneda. Kids enjoyed robot checking-in and our, even though not working for checking in with international credit cards. Not hesitate to stay there again in our next trip in Tokyo. ❤️ it.

Great hotel. Good location. Clean. Neat. The room was a little larger than expected which was a nice surprise. The check in machine didn’t like MasterCard so we were saved by a helpful human! What I didn’t realise was the room remote did lights, tv and aircon. Once in English that was great !

Location of the hotel is great, right near the train station. Convenience stores nearby. Perfect view of Tokyo Tower. Interesting to check-in to a hotel by robots, but that was fun. A "real" person is nearby should you run into trouble checking in. Room is clean, but wished it was a little bigger to place our luggages. Just a bit smaller than other hotels in Japan. Best of all non-stop from Haneda airport to the train station.

What i absolutely loved about the henn na hotel hamamatsucho was it’s location. It’s almost in the middle lf down town tokyo so it’s equidistance to get from one end of the yamanote to the other. My main gripe about my stay would be about the room. The wall socket on the desk is too close to the desk so i couldnt plug in my international adaptor to use my appliances on the desk. I had to plug it into the socket at the head of the bed which created a tripping hazard. The bed itself is not really a bed but like 3 thin matteress put together to form a bed. As such the gap between the lining makes for awful lumbar support and i literally woke up everyday with a backache in my back. It got pretty bad by day 12. This and the socket matter is what would have gotten them 5 points.

Hotel is near train station and our room has a view of the Tokyo tower! Interesting to check in & out using the robot too. If staff assistance is required, we are able to call them using a phone (when we left our luggage with them earlier). Only thing is it would be good if the room is bigger, but in general, Tokyo hotel rooms are smaller.

Stayed in Phiten space design floor. Very comfortable, extremely clean and many great amenities in room like foot massager, LG clothes styler with good space saving design. Location fantastic, very close to JR train station and subway. Best of all, only 20min by monorail to Haneda airport.

Very little English spoken here compared to other hotels. Had to wait until exactly 3 pm for check in which was extremely frustrating as our luggage had been in our room for 3 hours! Probably won’t stay here again as we like the personal touch

The location of this hotel was perfect for our trip to Tokyo, with lots of conveniences and transport options nearby. It was particularly easy to get to from Haneda airport. I was very grateful for the complimentary phone with local plan and data to stay in touch with other friends and navigate the city when we were out.Yes the rooms are small, but the description was accurate. They had an airy feel and we could still spend some time in the room to relax. A block away, in the World Trade Building, is an observatory deck, well worth a visit on dusk.Staff were most helpful when we arrived in the morning to store our luggage for the day before the automated check-in.

The hotel is near from Hamamatsucho Station and near to Asakusa Line. Makes it perfect for a stay if you're flying from Haneda Airport. The Hotel is very clean but not very big (common for Japan) , great Plus is the LG Styler for refreshing your clothes with steam.Around the hotel are different restaurants, bars and shops. We recommend to try out Nikuman restaurant (a very highlight on our trip)!

Clean, well located (many transportation). No staff at the welcome reception, but humanoid robot in the lobby. Avoid the breakfast in the irish pub, and go @le pain quotidien, 10 min walking distance.

If you don't mind a room with just enough room to squeeze your suitcases open and jump into bed, then this is the place for you. The bed was super comfortable, the wifi was great and the TV was absolutely massive and came with chromecast so no need to attempt to decipher Japanese TV shows, you can just watch whatever you want from your phone OR from the complimentary phone that is given to you with the room. It was super handy as a back-up to carry with us during the day and you get free calls in Japan and surrounding countries. The room also came with a free-standing steaming machine by LG, which, admittedly, wasn't really useful for us casual tourists but would come in handy on a business trip. It's in a very convenient location 5 minutes away from Hamamatsucho station that's on the JR Yamanote line (perfect for Rail Pass holders). Plus, you are close to a Lawson and 7-Eleven as well as a Denny's restaurant that is open late in case you return from your travels late. Although a lady had to come out and check us in because the robots didn't manage to (probably because we weren't Japanese nationals and needed a proper human to confirm we were in the country), overall the hotel is superb value for money.

Check-in was quick and easy. The hotel is just like the pictures and very clean. The bed and pillows are comfortable, I love the blankets and the AC is amazing. Breakfast line was well organized and tasty.

The Hotel has a excellent location and is 2min to train station. The reception is crazy with the robots :-). Rooms a clean but not so big (normal in Tokyo). Good coffee shop at the first floor and Staff was really friendly.

We stayed for 1 night due to the late arrival at Haneda, Tokyo and an early departure from Haneda on the next day.We arrived at Haneda almost mid-night. Their shuttle bus to the hotel was every one hour and we needed to wait for 30min till the next shuttle bus so we decided to go by taxi. It was very close from the airport and cost about 2000 yen.The check-in was easy and if you have a problem, the actual person came out and help you.The room was not big but not too small, we could manage to open our big suitcase x 1 and a small suitcase x 1.It was very clean, tidy and very practical. There was a machine (looks like a fridge) still not sure what that was but I put my jacket in and tried one of the function (to kind of clean your cloths?) and it worked!!! If I have a chance to stay there again, which I would love to, I will try to use it more!It was a short stay but highly recommended.

Fully compact, modern, little room with all the necessary amenities for comfort. Check-in was fast and efficient. It was oddly comfortable to walk past the reception without the usual precursory greeting. Highly recommended for it’s proximity to Hamamasutcho and Daimon station. I am now keen to stay at the other Henn Na locations.

Service driven hotel. All facilities you need as business man included. Clean room and good coffee shop just outside hotel.Central location close to metro station.Including free steam cleaner at the hotel room.

Good location, affordable, virtually all we could ask for. Wifi speed a little slow at times and bed was quite hard. Would stay again though was very convenient. Nice and clean. Near the subway which is good.

OK - I admit it..... we did stay here, as opposed to other hotels near the Tokyo Monorail for an early morning flight from Haneda airport, because having a hotel run by robots sounds kinda cool ! To be fair the whoe robot receptionist thing does work well.... they are very lifelike and so on.... but that shouldn't be the only reason to stay here as the location is very convenient for both the Monorail terminal for fast connection to the airport and the JR line for fast connection to the rest of the city. The room, as one expects in Tokyo, is small but manageable. There is some kind of a wonder clothers steamer - cleaner press that looks a bit like a fridge. No idea if it was any good as we only stayed one night and it would have taken days to work out what it did and how one gets it to do it....Had to be up early and missed breakfast - but from our brief stay I can reccomend this hotel - clean, very convenient - with Robot receptionists !!

Not as suitable for female guests...amenities given are not female user friendly...like shavers etc. Beds are made only once in 3 days! The best feature of the room is a clothes refresher. Room lights TV etc controlled with handy phone which u need to set. So one has to have some tech knowlege...not for old timers.

Very interesting hotel, two robots at the lobby for check-in (but no worry, in case you need help you can call humans!) and little and clean rooms.Everything you need for a short stay. When you stay in the right side, you can enjoy the view if Tokyo tower.

Whether you are looking for an overnight stay for your flight on the following day or a base to explore Tokyo, you should consider this hotel. It is within three minutes walk from the Hamamatsucho JR station, which also housed the Tokyo monorail (to Haneda), and the Diamon Metro station. Getting around tokyo is a breeze with the Yamanote Loop and the Metro around the corner. The hotel is on a quiet side street. There is a restaurant inside the hotel but with so many others around, you may want to try different types of food.We were a little bit skeptical about the robot receptionists but the check-in turned out to be very straight forward. In case you encounter any problem during your stay, just pick up the phone or ring the bell, both being on the front desk, human help arrives in a matter of seconds.

A fun check in with robots! I was a little disappointed with the room size but it’s close to my work so don’t too bad. I booked with breakfast and wasn’t aware that breakfast consisted of no options but a large hotdog which was nice but the garlic taste repeated on me all day

If you come here just for the robot, please save yourself a trip. No interaction but just a gimmick. Hotel room is new and clean but super tiny. The positives things are proximity to monorail station, the LG machine and the super huge large screen TV. Breakfast is huge hotdog. The robots are just dummies. I had to use the phone to call someone most of the time. Love the LG machine though. Clothing came out clean and straighter than being ironed.

Very close to JR and Monorail stations. Convenient to get around and to get to Haneda Airport in the wee hours. Checked in and out by robots. Assistant phone available and my requests were quickly entertained.The bonus — a steam and dry wardrobe, and free hand phone.

Stayed here on 28th to 30 May 2018.Robot check in and check out services. Very tiny rooms. The location is really good. I do not find anything good about the Hotel.There is a big TV and a large LG styler.
